editionStmt.p: The initial version of this file was created from data kindly provided by the Ethiopic Manuscript Imaging Project directed by Steve Delamarter.

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens und Eritreas: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / Beta maṣāḥǝft

licence.p: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msContents.summary: Images 5r-136l: Psalms 1-123. Each psalm receives another small superscription in the upper margin, written in the same hand and ink as the base text. The midpoint of the Psalms is marked with a small harag and two full-stop symbols. The manuscript has a complete ቃሉ system, including qalu summaries for each chapter (including for each section of Psalm 118) and the summary text at the end of the Biblical Canticles and before the Song of Songs. Images 136r-139r: Image of Abib, መልክዐ፡ ኣቢብ፡, incomplete at the beginning and also near the end where several folios are covered with illuminations. Image 1r: Opening prayer to the Psalter, written in another hand and ink. Image 3r: record of transaction of some sort. The ink has been effaced. Image 4l: top, record of agricultural produce. bottom, excerpt of Nags, written in blue ink.

revisionDesc.change: Created XML record from EMIP Collection Metadata.xsls
